result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Amended Information filed by Atty Cross

Defendant Barry Benson in court, in custody with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, wavies reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Court sentences defendant to 6 years 6 months prison, 1 year 6 months initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision, $268.00 costs and $250.00 DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample, no contact w/S.D.K., Sex Offender Registry, 97 days sentence credit, sentence to commence forthwith, Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program

Defendant Barry Benson in court, in custody with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
